intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron xylocarpum var. attenuatum, commonly known as the slender-fruited elaeodendron, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and distinctive fruiting structures. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a pale yellow color, and it produces woody capsules as its fruit. This variant is notable for its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations in its native habitat.
